item.title: Lowest Weekly Government Bond Supply Expected in Eurozone This Week
item.description: Government bond issuance in the eurozone is expected to reach around €8.5 billion this week, marking the lowest weekly volume of the year, Commerzbank Research said.

item.title: Metals Mixed as Demand Continues to Struggle
item.description: Base metals prices were mixed while gold edged higher in early London trading, with indexes continuing to be stifled by weak global growth.

item.title: Dollar Should Stay Strong This Week as Traders Await Jackson Hole
item.description: The dollar should hold onto its recent gains this week due to rising U.S. government-bond yields and anticipation of Powell’s speech at the Jackson Hole symposium, ING said.

item.title: Oil Rises As Speculators Bet on Higher Prices
item.description: Oil prices rose, with speculators looking to position for higher prices in the near future, amid tight inventories globally.

item.title: UK House Prices Fall at Fastest Rate Since 2018
item.description: The average house price in the U.K. fell 1.9% in the month to August 12, outpacing the usual summer slowdown.

item.title: India's Sensex Rises 0.2%, Led by Tech Stocks
item.description: Indian shares were higher, led by tech stocks, as concerns recede for now about policy tightening by central banks and higher costs of borrowing.

item.title: U.A.E. Cashes In on Russia's Economic Woes
item.description: The Gulf state is capitalizing on the Ukraine war’s economic opportunities like few other countries.

item.title: IKEA is set to open a store Wednesday in San Francisco's beleaguered downtown district, which has been hollowed out by an exodus of workers and has struggled with crime, drug abuse and homelessness.
item.description: IKEA is set to open a store Wednesday in San Francisco’s beleaguered downtown district, which has been hollowed out by an exodus of workers and has struggled with crime, drug abuse and homelessness.

item.title: Old Dominion Freight Line outbid a rival with a $1.5 billion offer for bankrupt trucker Yellow's sprawling North American real-estate holdings.
item.description: Old Dominion Freight Line outbid a rival with a $1.5 billion offer for bankrupt trucker Yellow’s sprawling North American real-estate holdings.

item.title: Chinese tourists are again flocking to Macau's casinos, propelling the city back above Las Vegas as the world's most lucrative gambling hub.
item.description: Chinese tourists are again flocking to Macau’s casinos, propelling the city back above Las Vegas as the world’s most lucrative gambling hub.

item.title: Investors are rushing to scoop up money-market funds and other cash-like instruments that are offering robust returns after a decade of ultralow rates.
item.description: Investors are rushing to scoop up money-market funds and other cash-like instruments that are offering robust returns after a decade of ultralow rates.

item.title: China's biggest e-commerce firms, Alibaba and JD.com, are moving toward selling more discounted goods as Chinese shoppers hunt for bargains amid economic uncertainty.
item.description: China’s biggest e-commerce firms, Alibaba and JD.com, are moving toward selling more discounted goods as Chinese shoppers hunt for bargains amid economic uncertainty.

item.title: Bond investors say the summer selloff in U.S. Treasury debt is providing the best buying opportunity in years.
item.description: Bond investors say the summer selloff in U.S. Treasury debt is providing the best buying opportunity in years.

item.title: The crash left India better poised to become the first country to land on the moon's south pole, an achievement that would solidify its position as a major space power amid renewed global interest in lunar exploration.
item.description: The crash left India better poised to become the first country to land on the moon’s south pole, an achievement that would solidify its position as a major space power amid renewed global interest in lunar exploration.

item.title: Sen. Romney of Utah, who has become a pariah for some Republicans because of his rejection of Trump, plans to announce soon whether he will seek a second term.
item.description: Sen. Romney of Utah, who has become a pariah for some Republicans because of his rejection of Trump, plans to announce soon whether he will seek a second term.

item.title: Russia's first mission to the moon in nearly 50 years ended in a disaster as its unmanned Luna-25 spacecraft crashed while attempting to land on the unexplored south pole, Russian authorities said.
item.description: Russia’s first mission to the moon in nearly 50 years ended in a disaster as its unmanned Luna-25 spacecraft crashed while attempting to land on the unexplored south pole, Russian authorities said.

item.title: Meta Platforms, Apple, Alphabet's Google and other large---and largely American---tech companies will by next week start facing the first of new EU tech rules set to come into effect over coming months, marking the largest expansion in digital regulation ever in the West.
item.description: Meta Platforms, Apple, Alphabet’s Google and other large—and largely American—tech companies will by next week start facing the first of new EU tech rules set to come into effect over coming months, marking the largest expansion in digital regulation ever in the West.

item.title: The U.S. and China are accelerating research on how to integrate artificial intelligence into their militaries.
item.description: The U.S. and China are accelerating research on how to integrate artificial intelligence into their militaries.

item.title: Canada's oil-rich province of Alberta has become the latest jurisdiction to push back against renewable-energy initiatives, declaring a seven-month moratorium on new wind and solar projects.
item.description: Canada’s oil-rich province of Alberta has become the latest jurisdiction to push back against renewable-energy initiatives, declaring a seven-month moratorium on new wind and solar projects.

item.title: Bernardo Arévalo won a landslide presidential election victory in Guatemala as voters pinned their hopes on the center-left politician, who campaigned on an anticorruption platform.
item.description: Bernardo Arévalo won a landslide presidential election victory in Guatemala as voters pinned their hopes on the center-left politician, who campaigned on an anticorruption platform.
